I downloaded this iso and then mounted it, extracted to a folder then burned contents to a CD.  I cannot get it to boot.  I get a black screen with "error loading operating system."

It autoruns in WindowsXP but it will ask for a serial number and once it restarts the computer, it will hang up when trying to complete the install..

What am I doing wrong?

hy , guys i have a problem :/ . When i start burning this xp to cd , it says there isnt that much space on a cd ! 

What to I do ?
You need a CDRW not a CDR.

WHAT ABOUT The 'ACTIVATION' Process?
IS WINDOWS GOING TO HOUND ME TO ACTIVATE?
You need a DVD, not a CD or CD-RW.  An RW is still a CD 700MB or 650MB.  RW means it's just re-writtable.
Oh I should also add WHAT sata driver are you supporting?  There are plenty of them.  J-Micron and Intel are both on my motherboard for example and you need different drivers to use one or the other.
